In the Prosyana Direction, Russian forces continued to advance and have crossed the border into Zaporizhzhia Oblast.
Russian forces advanced in two areas. Most progress was made in the north, where they advanced on a wide front. The Russians continued to advance west of Zelene Pole and entered southern Temyrivka. The rest of the village fell quite quickly, with the Ukrainian withdrawing to the surrounding areas. 
To the east, Russian forces made new progress down the treelines in the direction of Novoheorhiivka and Komyshuvakha, capturing positions in 6 different treelines. 
In the south, Russian forces advanced from the village of Novodarivka, along the Zaporizhzhia-Donetsk Regional Border, and captured new positions in the low-lying ground. 
+ ~13.38km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

Following the fall of Chasiv Yar, the remaining city administrative and military officials in Kramatorsk have begun to relocate to Dnipro. Evacuations of civilians is also being ramped up. 
It's now clear why the Donetsk OVA Head announced the mandatory evacuation of families with children so suddenly last week - they knew Chasiv Yar was about to fall.
New images from Chasiv Yar's city centre showing the extent of the damage suffered over the 16-month-long battle for the city.
New images from Chasiv Yar's city centre showing the extent of the damage suffered over the 16-month-long battle for the city.

Russian forces have captured the village of Zatyshok, Pokrovsk direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~62.
Total land area: ~0.39km¬≤.

I should've mentioned this earlier, but the chat connected to this channel will now have stricter moderation. Temporary mutes will be handed out to people using slurs, or insulting others excessively, and permanent mutes or occasionally bans will be given for more serious infractions such as posting uncensored gore, nudity, etc. Just use common sense and don't be a jerk, and you will be fine. 
There will still be free-speech and people are welcome to voice their opinions whether you are Pro-Russian, Pro-Ukraine, Neutral, or anything else, but it must be done in a respectful manner. You are allowed to criticize admins, but within obvious limits. 
When you have a channel with many conflicting perspectives, you need stricter moderation, or otherwise it falls apart. I aim for the chat to become more productive, but also not formal. Appeals will be in DMs.

Russian forces have captured the village of Sukhetske, Pokrovsk direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~39.
Total land area: ~0.32km¬≤.

Russian forces have captured the village of Nykanorivka, Pokrovsk direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~250.
Total land area: ~1.35km¬≤.

Russian forces have captured the village of Troyanda, Pokrovsk direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~80.
Total land area: ~0.20km¬≤.

In the Kupyansk direction, Russian forces continued to advance and have made significant progress in the direction of Pishchane. 
Following a series of Ukrainian counterattacks, Russian forces cleared the houses in western Stepova Novosilka which Ukraine had previously infiltrated, and pushed back down to railway line to the strongpoints in the area of the road bridge. These fortifications were subsequently captured, forcing a Ukrainian withdrawal further west, and a Russian advance further down the windbreaks on either side of the railway tracks. These positions are all on the tactical heights.
Additional pushes were made to the northwest, with Russian forces attacking down the treelines along the tactical heights, where they captured further positions north of the highway to Kupyansk in the treelines and forest plantations there.
+ ~10.80km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Borova direction, Ukrainian forces counterattacked and regained some positions in Luhansk Oblast.
Ukrainian forces advanced from the southern forest west of Hrekivka, and cleared the adjacent treelines. They then moved south down the perpendicular treelines on the tactical heights, pushing along the western bank of the tributary of the Zherebets River, and pressuring the rear of the Russian garrison in Hrekivka. 
+ ~0.99km¬≤ in favour of Ukraine.

In the Lyman direction, Russian forces continued to make incremental progress east of the Nitrius River, and have re-established a bridgehead on its western bank.
Russian forces advanced in three areas. In the northwest, they cleared the pocket east of the Nitrius River, and advanced back over one of the dams, establishing a foothold on the western bank in previously lost positions in southwestern Karpivka.
To the southeast, Russian forces continued to expand their zone of control west of Zelena Dolnya, and captured new positions on two opposite tactical heights, and in the forest plantations lining the gulley. They were also able to establish a foothold in the next set of forest plantations, northeast of Shandryholove. 
In the east, Russian forces resumed their assault operations after being pushed out of Kolodyazi, and re-entered the village, capturing most of the industrial zone and part of the residential area in the centre of the settlement.
+ ~7.31km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

Russia Accuses NATO Of Planning Provocations In The Arctic And Baltic
Nikolai Patrushev, Chairman of the Russian Maritime Board, stated that Western states, faced with the ineffectiveness of sanctions pressure against Russia, have begun to carry out planned provocations step by step in various sections of the Transarctic Transport Corridor: in the Arctic, the Barents and Baltic Seas, as well as in the Pacific Ocean.
He emphasized that direct attacks on Russian vessels, maritime infrastructure facilities, and even foreign ships ‚Äì with subsequent blame shifted onto Moscow ‚Äì cannot be ruled out.
Key points of his address:
‚ñ™Ô∏è
 The Baltic Sea is turning into an area of military-political instability due to NATO‚Äôs actions. 
‚ñ™Ô∏è
 Poland is demanding a revision of international shipping norms in the Baltic Sea, declaring it has become ‚ÄúNATO‚Äôs internal sea.‚Äù
‚ñ™Ô∏è
 Western countries are challenging Russia‚Äôs jurisdiction over the Northern Sea Route...
üëâ

Come and See: The War in Ukraine, Unfiltered. A Video Selection from July 24-31 
In a time flooded with relentless propaganda and misinformation, it‚Äôs increasingly difficult to discern reality. Yet, one thing remains constant‚Äîfirsthand accounts and unfiltered footage that capture the raw essence of the conflict. In this compilation, we present a selection of some of the most shocking, sorrowful, and occasionally absurd moments captured from both the frontlines and the rear. No filters, no distortions‚Äîjust the war as it unfolded over the past week.

Trump's Economic Warfare Targets Virtually Entire BRICS
After Donald Trump once again became the President of the United States, tariffs became the new buzzword in¬†the halls of power in Washington DC. He's using them not only against America's numerous geopolitical adversaries, but also vassals and satellite states that he wants to exploit in hopes of reinvigorating the US economy. 
However, the last several days of Trump's moves demonstrate his very limited understanding of the geopolitical consequences of such actions. Namely, apart from the ongoing attempts to probe Russia's and¬†China's capabilities through economic warfare, the US government is also targeting India and Brazil (in other words, all four founding member states of what today is¬†the rapidly growing BRICS+ format).
Used to cut-throat, swindler tactics of the ruthless American real estate business, Trump believes he can use the "small carrot, big stick" approach to resuscitate America's geopolitical dominance...
üëâ

Russia‚Äôs Geran-3 Jet-Powered Drones Are Causing Headache In Kiev
At least eight jet-powered suicide drones were among more than 300 launched by Russia during an attack on Ukraine early on July 31, Ukrainian Air Force (UAF) spokesman Yuri Ignat revealed, warning that these drones are harder to track and intercept than propeller-driven models.
The drone in question is likely the Geran-3, which is said to be a Russian copy of the Shahed-238 first presented by Iran last November.
‚ÄúBasically, on radar it is displayed as a cruise missile by flight parameters, because the speed there can be 500-plus kilometers per hour ,‚Äù Ignat explained. ‚ÄúNot all means that we use today can intercept such targets.‚Äù
The Geran-3 is reported to have a range of 2,000-2,500 kilometers and can climb to an altitude of up to nearly ten kilometers. Its turbojet engine produces a maximum speed of up to 600 kilometers per hour. 
üëâ

Israel Evacuates UAE Embassy Amid Fear Of Attacks
Israel began evacuating most of its diplomatic mission staff in the United Arab Emirates, Hebrew media reported late on July 31, right after the National Security Council (NSC) sharpened its travel warning for Israelis staying in the Gulf country.
‚ÄúThis comes amid growing indications that terrorist organizations (including Iranian-affiliated groups, Hamas, Hezbollah and global Jihad) are stepping up efforts to harm Israelis,‚Äù the council said in a statement.
It is believed there is increased motivation for revenge‚Äù following Israel‚Äôs war with Iran, ‚Äúin addition to rising anti-Israel incitement and pro-Palestinian sentiment,‚Äù the council added. ‚ÄúIn light of this, the NSC emphasizes the potential for terrorist attacks against Israeli and Jewish targets in the UAE, particularly around Jewish holidays and Sabbaths.‚Äù
